english: used in transliterations; Sanskrit “ka/ga” sound; element in Buddhist names; surname

etymology.interpretation: Combines the 'movement/road' radical 辶 with the phonetic 加 to indicate the sound jiā. The motion semantic is typical of the 辶 family, but in later and modern usage it functions mainly as a phonetic element in transcribing Indic and other foreign names.

examples.chinese: 我们在圣经课上讨论迦南的历史。(我們在聖經課上討論迦南的歷史。)
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài Shèngjīng kè shàng tǎolùn Jiānán de lìshǐ.
examples.english: We discussed the history of Canaan in Bible class.

examples.chinese: 他向释迦牟尼像献花。(他向釋迦牟尼像獻花。)
examples.english: He offered flowers to a statue of Shakyamuni.

examples.chinese: 传说中，迦叶是佛陀的大弟子。(傳說中，迦葉是佛陀的大弟子。)
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō zhōng, Jiāyè shì Fótuó de dà dìzǐ.
examples.english: In legend, Kāśyapa was one of the Buddha’s chief disciples.
